description:
Come and learn how to make delicious home-made pasta in a small group of like-minded people. I will welcome you with some homemade antipasti and a glass of wine to help you unwind from your day, then we will get busy together to make the dough, shape it and adjust the filling to your taste. We will make the delicious cannelloni, cylinders of pasta filled with cheese and cooed in the oven with a bechamel and tomato sauce. And once that is done, we'll quickly spin out some tagliolini, really really thin noodles that are perfect with the traditional lemon and prosciutto sauce from Bologna.


After cooking, we will eat the yummy pasta together with a nice glass of wine, conversation flows easily and the atmosphere is warm and fragrant from the oven, a great ending for a winter evening.

All ingredients, equipment, food and drinks (2 glasses of wine/ 2 beers) are included and you get pictures of the evening and recipes as well!

Cook

Socialise 

Eat yummy handmade food

Go home with the recipes of what you have made
name: CANNELLONI AND TAGLIOLINI Make Your Own Fresh Pasta Workshop

description:
This is a fun active way of spending an evening with interesting people who may just turn out to be your next date... Or the love of your life!
When the ingredients are there, the sky is the limit.
6 men and 6 women
Recipes for a three course dinner, kitchen equipment and ingredients
Drinks and snacks to keep the juices flowing
A fun format that will keep you moving and interacting with all the other singles, in small groups that avoid the confrontation of the speed date while providing a much closer connection.
You won't be talking about how long you've been in Brussels, or what exactly you do for work... You'll have better things to do!
The first Cook and Meet was a blast, a great evening where people had fun getting to know each other and making delicious food... Check out the pictures on FB: www.facebook.com/youcanpasta
name: Cook and Meet - cooking game for singles

description:
This time we make beautiful specialties from BOLOGNA: tortellini (the envelopes filled with a tasty mix of meat and parmesan) and tagliatelle (flat noodles that lovingly circle your fork to provide you with scrumptious deliciousness).

The tagliatelle will be the normal yellow ones and some free ones, for a traditional 'paglia e fieno' mix to be served with the Bolognese typical meat sauce. 

Relax after work with a little apero, meet fun new people and then make the pasta. If you use my sumo-aerobics technique you will even get a bit of a work-out!

After all that effort, a well deserved rest, where you eat the fresh pasta you have just prepared and enjoy a lovely glass of wine or of my special spicy lemonade. Yummy! Any leftovers are good for takeaway, take advantage and show your family or friends what you have learned! 

I provide aprons and will send you the recipes (in English). The menu can be adapted for vegetarians (please let me know in advance). 

Soft drinks and two glasses of wine per person are included, you are welcome to bring more wine or beer if you like.
how_to_find_us: I will send an email with the details when you sign up
name: Create Bolognese specialties *tortellini and tagliatelle*

description:
I would like to invite you to take part in the next You Can Pasta workshop, where we will learn how to make fresh pasta and share our creations with laughter and a glass of wine. On Friday 28 March we will start at 7 pm with the following programme:


- apero on arrival, a glass of wine or juice and meet all the other participants - it's always a good mix of men and women, Italian and international- get ready to get busy: roll up your sleeves, put on the apron (I have enough for everyone) and go!- make the dough: it's grandma's recipe and my sumo-aerobics technique for kneading, fun and active- shape and cut- cook and add sauce: I do this part while you relax!- eat and drink: every workshop produces two or three kinds of beautiful handmade pasta, enjoy it with the homemade sauces I propose... each pasta has a sauce! 


Friday 28 we will be making 

potato gnocchi, green lasagne and tagliatelle

Let me know if you are vegetarian or prefer to avoid pork, or if you have other issues. 

See more information on my website and Facebook page, to sign up you can just click on the link to pay online, or write me an email if you prefer a bank transfer instead. The fee is 40 euros.


https://www.facebook.com/youcanpasta

http://www.youcanpasta.eu

Sign up while there are still spaces! I'm looking forward to meeting you soon. If you have questions don't hesitate to come back to me.
name: BOLOGNESE Specialties *second edition*
